CN.content:

Paragraph: Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |

| DTPD acceptor moiety |
| polymers |

The two material names identified in the paragraph are "DTPD acceptor moiety" and "polymers".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD acceptor moiety |

After reviewing the paragraph, I confirm that the two identified material names, "DTPD acceptor moiety" and "polymers," are still valid. These entities unambiguously refer to materials in the context of the paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| light absorption range |
| HOMO level |
| LUMO level |

The three "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are "light absorption range," "HOMO level," and "LUMO level." These entities are the properties being discussed or modified in the context of the DTPD acceptor moiety and the polymers.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| light absorption range |
| HOMO level |
| LUMO level |

After reviewing the paragraph again, I confirm that the three entities identified earlier, "light absorption range," "HOMO level," and "LUMO level," are indeed material properties. These properties are characteristics or aspects of the materials (polymers and DTPD acceptor moiety) being discussed in the paragraph. Therefore, no changes are needed in the presented Markdown table.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Remarkably , the DTPD acceptor moiety effectively widens the light absorption range of the polymers up to ∼ 900 nm while positioning their HOMO and LUMO levels in the optimal range , i.e.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| up to ~ 900 nm |
| in the optimal range |

The two "Property Value" entities identified in the paragraph are "up to ~ 900 nm" and "in the optimal range." These entities represent the range of light absorption and the positioning of the HOMO and LUMO levels of the polymers, respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| up to ~ 900 nm |

After reviewing the paragraph, only one clear "Property Value" entity was found: "up to ~ 900 nm." This entity represents the range of light absorption of the polymers. The other entity, "in the optimal range," is not a specific value and therefore does not clearly refer to a "Value of material property."
